It is characterized by its unique, spire-like inflorescence that resembles a crown, giving it its common name. The plant's leaves are dark green and densely arranged, forming a dense canopy that shelters its delicate flowers. Its reproductive structures are highly specialized, with tiny, white flowers clustered in dense, spiky heads. Due to its limited habitat and specific ecological requirements, Sciodaphyllum capitulispicatum is considered a vulnerable species.
